answers.answer: Chinese red dates as suggested by Dr. Zhang. Also, he has a herbal formula for that, so I only needed 12 vials of Procrit(sinomedresearchdotorg). I treated for 51 weeks.
Thanks I'll look into it ..I have other complications,Ulcers,... so I have to be certain that it won't affect my stomach.

What did your hgb start at?  A 2 point drop is significant altho you are not yet at a level to require a boost.  Did you discuss Epogen (Procrit) before you started tx?  Frankly, I don't think there are any natural ways to combat hemolytic anemia.  The drop is too fast and too severe to recover with herbs and vegetables.  Believe me, none of us wanted to take yet another shot, but after we did and had positve results we thought it was well worth it.  My GI referred me to a hemotologist (blood doc) at the beginning of tx because he said I needed to get my foot in the door --- that it was hard to get in in a hurry when you needed it.  It was one of the best things he did for me.  I had my blood drawn weekly throughout tx to determine whether I needed Procrit or Neupogen (for the ANC drop).You should be getting CBCs at least every other week at the beginning of tx.  Are you?  Watch that hgb closely.  My hemotologist let me begin Procrit when the hgb dropped into the 10s nd for that I was very grateful.frijole

ThanksI had blood drawn on the second week.....my hgb went from 15 pretreatment to 12....My doctor wanted me to come in again Tues for a visit & blood check...I'll take my fourth shot tonight...my liver was really inflamed so I didn't want to shock the liver too much so the doctor with my suggestion started with 1/2 the dose of pegsys,..followed by 3/4 the second week,.. to full the 3rd week (The sx seemed a lot less also)We didn't want the AST & ALT counts to climb,...    we didn't want the liver to become more inflamed again...The doctors never did figure out what caused my liver to inflameI hear bad things lately about the progrit sx real badthanks for the reply my friend

If your hemoglobin dropped from 15 to 12 within only a few weeks -- then you may be a candidate for Procrit (epo) as Frijole suggests. Don't know if you have too many side effects yet or not, but it can happen with an alarming suddeness. Weekly blood counts are in order with that drop. Also, Procrit can take 2-4 weeks to work, so you might want to get the insurance process moving. Don't know what you've heard about "Procrit sx" but I found them minimal and nothing compared to the sfx of anemia, not to mention that if you hgb drops too much they may have to pull you off tx or reduce your riba which will reduce your chance of SVR.Not sure what you mean that your liver was "inflamed" so you started with less Peg? The general principle is to hit the virus hard and fast in the beginning. If your liver was so inflamed at that point, why even start treatment then? I had what might be termed an inflammation from some Chinese Herbs -- ALT near 1000 -- and the decision was to delay tx until things calmed down.Are you being treated by a liver specialist (hepatologist) or a Gastro? Something about the protocol you're following leads me to believe it's a gastro. I'd see a hepatologist and get a second opinion on what's going on.-- Jim

btw I started Procrit at hgb 11.4. My pre-tx hgb was 14.8, but the more than 3-point drop in a couple of weeks put me in the ER. It's not the absolute number that's important but the rate of drop and the accompanying side effects that really matter.

Last July I went for a 6 month blood check .....The guy from the lab called me the next day my sugar was 560 he told me to get to a doctor right away....My ALT's were 1800 AST's over 1000...not sure of the exact number....They ended up going over 2300 ALT 1800 AST,.... I ended up with diabetesMy GP thought maybe the diabetes caused the counts to go out of wack....I got the diabetes under control first then the liver functions,....I do have a hepotologist....he was trying to figure out why the liver was so inflamed  .....something outside like a drug they were looking for...I was taking Advil for pain in my feet...I don't drink smoke cigarettes,....I had an MRI on the liver,I was worried about a tumor...it was clear...then had a second biop...stage 2,.... my first was in 1995  when I found out about it for the first time....I 've been waiting to treat for 12 yrs My VL were fluctuating between 300k to 2mil in that timeFinally got the counts down through diet,juicing,eliminating processed foods,.. pretreatment was ALT 700ish AST 400 We all agreed it would be a good chance to treat .... VL was 250,000 pretreatment not bad ....I ws reading about people having strokes & heart attacks because of the procrit?..I starte to add some meat to my diet in light of the hem drop...Thanks for the heads up on the insurance approvalI'm not feeling too bad flu like stuff chills for first  2 days after the shot...I'm only taking 800mg riba 4 pills a day I was concerned about that dose? maybe it's not enough?....I'm a 2b so that's what they gave me? I'll also find out about the procrit?I'll find out TuesdayThanks a bunch Jim

I'd try and keep on full-dose meds as much as possible, including weight based ribavirin. You can figure out your dose here and then discuss with your doctor:http://www.hivandhepatitis.com/2005icr/aasld/docs/111805_a.htmlJust keep in mind, that if weight-based for you is more than 800mg, then your hgb may drop even faster, but that's the name of the game if you want to rid yourself of the virus -- and that's where Procrit can be helpful.Your pre-tx viral load is a good sign, although those are quite high enzymes, but you've already started. I assume you'vve been monitoring your enzymes weekly since you started treating? I would with pre-tx enzymes that high. I'd also ask for weekly viral load tests until UND using as sensitive an assay as possible. Something like Heptimax from Quest Diagnostics that goes down to 5 IU/ml. If they won't do it weekly, at a minium have a week 4 test done. You draw blood for that test the day before your fifth injection.All  the best,-- Jim

My doc wanted weeky I didnt get there till my second week.....I lost a lot of wieght from the diabetes 30lbs....Maybe thats good...less riba though the pharmacy sent me enough for 1000mgDoc said take 4 I had a VL 2 weeks ago ,..I didn't get the result yet but the enzymes dropped in 1/2380 - 200ish....When would you take the blood work how soon after the shot?Before treatment the AST ALT increased from their lowest pt ...so I didn't want to miss the optMy GP told me he would have treated back in AugustThe hepatolgist wanted to try & figure out the cause of the high counts....I was walking around with pains in my side meanwhileAmazingAnd the best to you sir.....Man you type fast heh heh

Best to do the blood draw as close as possible to the injection, but before the injection. That will give you a conservative "trough" value. So, for example, if you inject Friday evening, you could have blood drawn either Thursday or anytime Friday, but before you inject. And if you can, keep doing those viral load tests every week until you're UND. BTW your results should have been in by now if you took the test 2 weeks ago. Make a pest of yourself if necessary, but have the nurse call the lab and get the results. And yes, I type fast but think slow, so forgi ve the typos :)-- Jim

I saw a chart somewhere recently on liver enzymes and it seems that when they bumped into the 1000s like that it was usually some outside source like a poison.  I guess that is whythey were looking for something like that.  I don't know what the inflamed liver means.  Normally, like Jim says, I agree that you should hit this virus hard in the beginning.  But you have multiply problems with the diabetes too that are beyond my comprehension.I know there are a lot of horror stories about the procirt but I think the key there is the weekly blood tests.  You don't want your hemoblobin to go up too high. Most of the problems occur when patient take too much.  The blood can get too thick and, yes, it can be a strain on the heart.  But on the other hand, google anemia and see how much damage to the system that can do.  Procrit is very helpful to us how suffered with the anemia, and I think you are in that category.frijole

Had blood checked  last Tues, AST ALT, were the same 380,180,.. Hg dropped to 11.4 new low,.. VL didn't come back yet?They were 250k when I started  Going for another check next week....On the wieght based riba I was wondering if I was taking enough?(...I read the link Jim posted but I'm not familar with metrics?) I'm 155lbs ,...I'm taking 800mgs (4 pills) I would like to take more if the Hg holds up kick it up to 1000mg (5 pills)? I told my doctor he wanted to monitor the Hg then make a decision?Sorry for the late responseThanks & gl folks

Ihttp://www.hivandhepatitis.com/2006icr/ddw/docs/052306_b.htmlIn this trial, adult, treatment-naïve HCV patients with compensated liver disease were randomized to receive PEG-IFN alfa-2b 1.5 μg/kg/week plus FD ribavirin (800 mg/day) or WBD ribavirin (800 mg/day for weight 85–105 kg, 1,400 mg/day for >105–125 kg).Rangle, 155 pounds would be 70.45kg.  I think you should be taking 1000 mg ribavirin.  Are you a genotype 2 or 3?  The standard dosing for 2 and 3 was 800mg, but there is a lot of discussion to use weight based dosing instead.  I think you may be underdosed but if you jump to 1000. your hemoglobin should really drop.  You will need to watch it.frijole
I'm type 2b I'll check it outThanks

question: Is there a natural way to boost my red blood cells,My counts dropped to 12 after just starting treatment?
title: Rangle
